description: The ORDER_MED table enables you to report on medications ordered in EpicCare (prescriptions). We have also included patient and contact identification information for each record.

columns.name: ORDER_MED_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the order record associated with this medication order. This is an internal unique identifier for ORD master file records in this table and cannot be used to link to CLARITY_MEDICATION.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL
columns.description: A unique, internal contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of the contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_CSN_ID
columns.description: The unique contact serial number (CSN) for the patient contact associated with this medication order. This number is unique across patients and encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).

columns.name: ORDERING_DATE
columns.description: The date when the medication order was placed.

columns.name: ORDER_CLASS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number for the order class. This value is used to define how clinical systems process the order.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Normal

columns.name: PHARMACY_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the pharmacy record that is associated with this medication order. This column is frequently used to link to the RX_PHR table. This field is only populated if the clinical system user selects a specific pharmacy from the  list, otherwise the field is null. This field is only populated by the ambulatory clinical system, not the pharmacy system.

columns.name: ORD_CREATR_USER_ID
columns.description: The EMP ID (.1) of the user who signed the order (for a non-signed and held order) or the last person who performed a sign and hold or release action for a signed and held order.

columns.name: MEDICATION_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the medication record that is associated with this order. In some circumstances, for example when Intelligent Medication Selection selects an IMS mixture, this column may contain template records that do not represent real medications. For this reason, it is recommended to use the Clarity column ORDER_MEDINFO.DISPENSABLE_MED_ID when reporting on medication orders.

columns.name: DESCRIPTION
columns.description: The description of the order. This information is found in the Order field of clinical systemï¿½s Order Detail window.

columns.name: DOSAGE
columns.description: The dispensation amount for the prescription entered by the user in the orders activity. This amount is stored as a string in the orders database.

columns.name: QUANTITY
columns.description: The quantity of the prescription being dispensed as entered by the user.

columns.name: REFILLS
columns.description: The number of refills allowed for this prescription as entered by the user.

columns.name: START_DATE
columns.description: The date when the medication order started. The date appears in calendar format.

columns.name: END_DATE
columns.description: The date when the medication order is to end.

columns.name: DISP_AS_WRITTEN_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether or not the prescription should be dispensed as written for this medication.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No

columns.name: RSN_FOR_DISCON_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number for the reason a prescription has been discontinued.  This column contains data only in prescription orders that have been discontinued.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: MED_PRESC_PROV_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the provider who has prescribed or authorized the medication order. The value in this column matches the value in the AUTHRZING_PROV_ID column.

columns.name: NONFRM_XCPT_CD_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number for medication's exception code.  This code explains the reason a non-formulary medication was ordered.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: PANEL_MED_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the medication panel that is associated with this medication order. This column is only populated if the medication order was originally placed as part of a panel.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: The date and time when this row was created or last updated in Clarity.

columns.name: ORDER_INST
columns.description: The date and time the order was placed. The date appears in calendar format.

columns.name: DISPLAY_NAME
columns.description: The name of the medication as it appears on the medication record itself.

columns.name: AS_MEDICATION_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the brand name medication originally chosen by the ordering user. This column is blank if the user did not chose a brand name record.  It is recommended to use the Clarity column ORDER_MEDINFO.DISPENSABLE_MED_ID when reporting on medication orders. Use AS_MEDICATION_ID if specifically searching for orders that were originally selected from a preference list as a brand name medication.

columns.name: HV_HOSPITALIST_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether  this is a hospitalist order. A Y indicates a hospitalist order.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: DISP_AS_WRITTEN_YN

columns.name: ORDER_PRIORITY_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number for the priority assigned to an order.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: MED_ROUTE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number for the route of administration of a medication.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: DISCON_USER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the user who discontinued the order.

columns.name: DISCON_TIME
columns.description: The date and time when the medication order was discontinued. The date appears in calendar format.

columns.name: CHNG_ORDER_MED_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the changed or reordered medication order that this order replaced. This column is frequently used to link back to the ORDER_MED table.

columns.name: PEND_APPR_USER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the user who approved a pended order.

columns.name: PEND_REF_REAS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number for the reason a pended medication was refused.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: HV_DISCR_FREQ_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the discrete frequency record associated with this medication order. This column is frequently used to link to the IP_FREQUENCY table.

columns.name: HV_DISCR_FREQ_ID_FREQ_NAME
columns.description: The name of the frequency record.

columns.name: HV_DISCRETE_DOSE
columns.description: The discrete dose for a medication as entered by the user in the orders activity.

columns.name: HV_DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number for the dosage unit of a medication.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: HV_IS_SELF_ADM_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether this medication was self-administered. A Y indicates that the order was self-administered.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: DISP_AS_WRITTEN_YN

columns.name: ORDER_START_TIME
columns.description: The date and time when the medication order is to start. The date appears in calendar format.

columns.name: ORDER_END_TIME
columns.description: The date and time when the medication order is scheduled to end. The date appears in calendar format.

columns.name: NON_FORMULARY_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether this medication is not on the formulary. A Y indicates a non-formulary medication.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: DISP_AS_WRITTEN_YN

columns.name: ORDER_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number for the current status of an order.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Pending


Sent


Resulted


Canceled


Completed


Holding for Referral


Denied Approval


Suspend


Discontinued


Verified


Dispensed


Pending Verify

columns.name: AUTHRZING_PROV_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the provider who has prescribed or authorized the medication order. The value in this column matches the value in the MED_PRESC_PROV_ID column.

columns.name: ORD_PROV_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the provider listed as the ordering provider.

columns.name: MIN_DISCRETE_DOSE
columns.description: The minimum ordered dose amount for the medication as specified by the user in the orders activity.

columns.name: MAX_DISCRETE_DOSE
columns.description: The maximum ordered dose amount for the medication as specified by the user in the orders activity.

columns.name: DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number for the dose unit of a medication.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: HV_DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME

columns.name: IS_PENDING_ORD_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the order has a pending status. A Y indicates that the order does have a pending status.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes

columns.name: BULK_DISP_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether this is a bulk dispense order. A Y indicates this is a bulk dispense order.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: DISP_AS_WRITTEN_YN

columns.name: PROVIDER_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The medication provider type category number for the order.  This item distinguishes between authorizing and documenting provider types for historical and non-historical medications.  If the medication was ordered as historical, the provider is considered the documenting provider and is reflected as such in this item.  If the medication was not ordered as historical, the provider is considered the authorizing provider is reflected in this item as such.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Authorizing


Documenting

columns.name: MODIFY_TRACK_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number for the flag that both indicates and distinguishes whether an order was reordered or modified.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


REORDERED


MODIFIED

columns.name: SPECIFIED_FIRST_TM
columns.description: If the order was placed with a Specified frequency (the frequency's Type (I EFQ 50) item has a value of 1) and the user specified a first occurrence time, the time specified is stored in this column.

columns.name: SCHED_START_TM
columns.description: The date and time at which an order was scheduled to begin. The date appears in calendar format.

columns.name: ACT_ORDER_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number indicating additional information about an order's status--Active, Completed, Discontinued, or Cancelled. An active order is any order that has not been completed, discontinued, cancelled, pended, or signed and held.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Active Medication


Active Procedure


Discontinued Medication


Canceled Procedure


Completed Medication


Completed Procedure

columns.name: EXP_AFT_START_DATE
columns.description: The number of days after the start date that the medication order will expire based on the setting in the medication record. The date appears in calendar format.

columns.name: EXP_BEF_END_DATE
columns.description: The number of days before the end date that the medication order will expire based on the setting in the medication record. The date appears in calendar format.

columns.name: MED_COMMENTS
columns.description: Comments for a medication order, as entered by the ordering user when entering the order.

columns.name: USER_SEL_MED_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the orderable medication that is evaluated for Intelligent Medication Selection (IMS). This item is blank if the order is not evaluated for IMS.  It is recommended to use the Clarity column ORDER_MEDINFO.DISPENSABLE_MED_ID when reporting on medication orders. Use USER_SEL_MED_ID if searching for medication orders that were evaluated by IMS.

columns.name: USER_SEL_ERX_DAT
columns.description: The date that the medication record was actually selected by the user.  This item is populated only if Intelligent Medication Selection (IMS) replaced the original user-selected medication with another medication record.

columns.name: REQ_RNVERIFY_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether this medication order requires RN verification before it is administered. A Y indicates that it does require RN verification.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: MDL_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the medication problem list record that is associated with this medication order. This column is frequently used to link to the MDL_MD_PRBLM_LIST table.

columns.name: LASTDOSE
columns.description: Comments for the last administered dose of a medication entered in the medication documentation navigator section.

columns.name: INFORMANT_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number for the informant of a prior to admission (PTA) medication.  The informant is the person who reports a PTA medication being taken by the patient.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: AMB_MED_DISP_NAME
columns.description: The name of the ambulatory medication.

columns.name: WEIGHT_BASED_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the dose for this medication order is based on the patient's weight.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: DISP_AS_WRITTEN_YN

columns.name: WEIGHT_REVIEW_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether or not the patient's weight needs to be reviewed for this medication order due to the patient's weight change.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: DISP_AS_WRITTEN_YN

columns.name: ORD_TM_WEIGHT
columns.description: The patient's last reviewed weight at the time the medication was ordered.

columns.name: ORDER_TIME_WT_INST
columns.description: The date and time when a new weight is recorded for a patient for a weight based medication review.

columns.name: REVIEW_WEIGHT
columns.description: The patient's last non-reviewed weight at the time the medication was ordered.

columns.name: REVIEW_WEIGHT_INST
columns.description: The instant when the patient's last non-reviewed weight was entered prior to when the medication was ordered.

columns.name: REFILLS_REMAINING
columns.description: The number of refills remaining in the medication.

columns.name: MED_REFILL_PROV_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the provider who authorized the medication refill order.

columns.name: OLD_ORDER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the order record that points to the parent medication for refills.

columns.name: OLD_ORDER_DAT
columns.description: The internal contact date of the parent medication in integer format.  Used to identify the parent medication and will only be populated for child orders.  This does not link to CONTACT_DATE_REAL.

columns.name: RESUME_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number that indicates an outpatient medication order's status before it was suspended as a result on inpatient admission.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: ORDER_STATUS_C_NAME

columns.name: USER_ID_OF_PROV
columns.description: The unique ID of the user record that is linked to the provider ID in the AUTHRZING_PROV_ID column.

columns.name: ORDERING_MODE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number for the ordering mode of the order (i.e. Outpatient, Inpatient).  Note that Outpatient orders can be placed from an Inpatient encounter as discharge orders / take-home prescriptions.  This column might be blank for Outpatient orders placed prior to the creation of the IP module.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Outpatient


Inpatient

columns.name: PEND_APPROVE_FLAG_C_NAME
columns.description:
The pending medication approval status category number for the order.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Approved


Refused

columns.name: NF_POST_VERIF_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether a medication order has been verified by the pharmacist as non-formulary. A Y indicates that the pharmacist verified the medication order as non-formulary. An administrator can use this column to report on how many orders that were placed as non-formulary were also verified as such. To find which orders were placed as non-formulary, use the NON_FORMULARY_YN column.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: REQ_RNVERIFY_YN

columns.name: END_BEFORE_CMP_INST
columns.description: The default end date and time of a completed order.  When an order is completed, we will store the system calculated end date and time (which may differ from the actual completion time) in this column in the event the completion is reversed and the defaults need to be restored.

columns.description:
Indicates whether the dose for this medication order is based on the patient's body surface area (BSA).
